radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is mildly distended and filled with stones. There is mild gallbladder wall thickening. No pericholecystic fluid is seen. The liver demonstrates normal parenchymal echogenicity. A previously noted echogenic lesion within the right lobe of the liver measuring about 1.8 cm appears stable with imaging characteristics compatible with a hemangioma. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilatation is present.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The echogenic lesion within the right lobe of the liver measuring about 1.8 cm appears stable.
